intro: Hieracium perlongum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, often surrounded by a ring of phyllaries. Hieracium perlongum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
